data.title: Code folding click on elipsis does not expand
data.body:
Have some code folded. Click on the elipses '...' - notice the code does not get expanded, it is still expanded.
The cursor has a pointer state which adds to the confusion.

I tried the last released stable and it is also not working there

data.title: HTML/JS/TS/SCSS/etc. class/id definition peeking
data.body:
Unfortunately , class/id etc. definition peeking `(Alt+F12)` is not appearing or if so, it appears extremely slow. And that is IF it decides to show or not. It works at random for me. (small and large projects)

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select a class/id , use `Alt+F12` shortcut on it.
2. Sit and wait forever/for a long period.

I also tried installing The [vscode-css-peek ](https://github.com/pranaygp/vscode-css-peek)extension just for trial, but the issue remains the same.

I think this might be Git related. It tends to show a peek (really slow or not at all) when there are no files in the Git queue.

![ylnx7b3wws](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9406520/22558510/a178972e-e976-11e6-973f-77b03e10d2f7.gif)

> This is reproducable each time I start vscode.

Current plugin set:

```
ActiveFileInStatusBar - Version :1.0.2
auto-rename-tag - Version :0.0.11
beautify - Version :0.7.3
Bookmarks - Version :0.10.2
code-settings-sync - Version :2.4.3
color-highlight - Version :1.3.0

HTMLHint - Version :0.3.3

jquerysnippets - Version :0.0.1
lorem-ipsum - Version :1.0.0
path-intellisense - Version :1.2.0
php-intellisense - Version :0.0.12
sass-indented - Version :1.3.0
stylelint - Version :0.21.2
terminal - Version :0.0.6
Theme-Easyballs - Version :0.0.2
vscode-autoprefixer - Version :2.0.0
vscode-color - Version :0.2.2
vscode-csscomb - Version :4.0.0
vscode-eslint - Version :1.2.2
vscode-gutter-preview - Version :0.8.2
vscode-npm-script - Version :0.1.8
vscode-scss - Version :0.6.0
vscode-simple-icons - Version :0.8.1
vscode-svgviewer - Version :1.3.0
```

data.title: A single top level task isn't marked as build tasks anymore
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.x
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. tasks.json
```json
{
	"version": "0.1.0",

	// we want to run npm
	"command": "npm",

	// the command is a shell script
	"isShellCommand": true,

	// show the output window only if unrecognized errors occur.
	"showOutput": "silent",

	// we run the custom script "watch" as defined in package.json
	"args": ["run", "watch"],

	// The tsc compiler is started in watching mode
	"isWatching": true,

	// use the standard tsc in watch mode problem matcher to find compile problems in the output.
	"problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
}
```
2. Press control shift B

Observe: VS Code complains that there is no build task defined. 

This is a regression and is caused by the rewrite of the way haw we parse tasks.json files to support multiple commands.

data.title: Add "(Administrator)" suffix to window title when running as administrator in Windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1, 1.9.0-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversary

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run VS Code / Insiders as administrator by right-clicking the icon and clicking "Run as Administrator"
2. Observe window title does not indicate that Code is running as administrator

Since running as administrator works pretty well now, the only thing that's missing is an indication that the window has been run as administrator.  Visual Studio (and other apps) use the title bar to indicate this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79405/22539525/6f8c8ce0-e8cf-11e6-885f-720ea355c7f5.png)

data.title: Thick Consolas Font

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Ultimate Service Pack 1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS code using the Dark/Dark+ themes
2. Compare the font to the one Visual Studio renders

Here's a side-by-side comparison:

VS Code vs. Visual Studio:

![VS Code Consolas Font](http://i.imgur.com/qdasKWA.png) ![](http://i.imgur.com/7YOkCK3.png)

Notice how Visual Studio's rendered version is thinner.

I tried setting the weight of the font using `editor.fontWeight` and setting it to the lowest possible value (100) but it's the same (surprisingly even for values 200, 300 etc.). This [issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/381url) has been referenced before but has produced no results and so I'm creating this issue to see if someone can get it fixed.

data.title: Don't start ts server with enable telemetry if user has disabled telemetry
data.body:
@dbaeumer / @mhegazy - Does the TS upload and telemetry data on its own when `tsserver` is run using `--enableTelemtry`. I know that vscode receives telemetry events from `tsserver`, but we do not actually upload them on our side if the user has disabled telemetry.


#19693

data.title: Inconsistent handling of multiple TextEdits on the same line
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.8.1 & 1.9.0-insider (Validation 27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, Date 2017-02-01T11:43:14.109Z)
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.2, Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to Reproduce:
Using the [vscode-java extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=redhat.java)
1. open a Java file
2. Type `Object o = new O`(+`ctrl+space`) to get autocompletion for the contructor `Object()`
3. select `Object()` and  press `Enter`

The inserted text is `O()`, instead of `Object()`.  See:
![inconsistent-textedit-behavior](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/148698/22527225/5f6875a0-e89c-11e6-9a38-2c196d8ef0d2.gif).

If you revert the change (`Ctrl+z`), you can see the complete constructor string was applied first, before being overridden by `()`.

Tracing the messages exchanged with the Java Language server, it seems the text edits returned by a call to `completionItem/resolve` are correct. As can be seen from L7225, from the [complete message log generated during the above recording](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/746256/autocompleting-object.txt):

```
[Trace - 14:58:25] Sending request 'completionItem/resolve - (113)'.
Params: {
    "label": "Object()",
    "detail": "java.lang.Object",
    "kind": 4,
    "sortText": "zzzzzzigdf",
    "data": {
        "decl_signature": "Ljava.lang.Object;",
        "signature": "()V",
        "name": "Object",
        "pid": "0",
        "rid": "44",
        "uri": "file:/home/fbricon/Dev/souk/test/src/main/java/A.java"
    }
}


[Trace - 14:58:25] Received notification 'window/logMessage'.
Params: {
    "type": 3,
    "message": "2017-02-01 13:48:38 >> document/resolveCompletionItem"
}


[Info  - 14:58:25] 2017-02-01 13:48:38 >> document/resolveCompletionItem
[Trace - 14:58:25] Received response 'completionItem/resolve - (113)' in 4ms.
Result: {
    "label": "Object()",
    "kind": 4,
    "detail": "java.lang.Object",
    "sortText": "zzzzzzigdf",
    "textEdit": {
        "range": {
            "start": {
                "line": 1,
                "character": 20
            },
            "end": {
                "line": 1,
                "character": 20
            }
        },
        "newText": "()"
    },
    "additionalTextEdits": [
        {
            "range": {
                "start": {
                    "line": 1,
                    "character": 19
                },
                "end": {
                    "line": 1,
                    "character": 20
                }
            },
            "newText": "Object"
        }
    ]
}


[Trace - 14:58:27] Sending notification 'textDocument/didChange'.
Params: {
    "textDocument": {
        "uri": "file:///home/fbricon/Dev/souk/test/src/main/java/A.java",
        "version": 18
    },
    "contentChanges": [
        {
            "range": {
                "start": {
                    "line": 1,
                    "character": 19
                },
                "end": {
                    "line": 1,
                    "character": 20
                }
            },
            "rangeLength": 1,
            "text": "Object"
        }
    ]
}


[Trace - 14:58:27] Sending notification 'textDocument/didChange'.
Params: {
    "textDocument": {
        "uri": "file:///home/fbricon/Dev/souk/test/src/main/java/A.java",
        "version": 19
    },
    "contentChanges": [
        {
            "range": {
                "start": {
                    "line": 1,
                    "character": 20
                },
                "end": {
                    "line": 1,
                    "character": 25
                }
            },
            "rangeLength": 5,
            "text": "()"
        }
    ]
}

```
The ranges for the `()` are wrong. 


On extremely rare occasions the inserted text is correct, but I'm unable to find a pattern to reproduce the working case.  Moreover, it seems the Orion IDE, using the same Java server, is not affected. Which makes me think this is definitely a vscode issue.

A second bug can be seen on the screencast, which could be a side-effect of this issue: after the proposals are displayed, typing the next letter to narrow down the selection actually deselect the 1st `Object()` proposal, only the new letter is highlighted. If it's unrelated, I'll open another issue. 

See also https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/143

 cc @gorkem

data.title: Respect telemetry.enableTelemetry Setting for TypeScript Telemetry
data.body: `"telemetry.enableTelemetry": false` should also disable telemetry in the typescript process

data.title: Use @types/node in extensions for node typings
data.body: Switches builtin extensions to use @types/node for node definitions. Fixes a few errors that show up as a result of updating to a more modern version of node.d.ts

data.title: Display Welcome Page only when opening a new Window
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable Welcome Page
2. Open a new Window

When the window is launched, Code will open an untitled file first and then open the Welcome Tab. Since the Welcome Page is active and introductory, we don't need necessarily open the untitled file at the beginning while we can put a `new file` action in the Welcome Page *Start* section

![screen shot 2017-02-01 at 1 24 39 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22526880/d009d9ae-e881-11e6-9aa8-f08c3215f9d1.png)

data.title: [Folding] Additional Code Folding, Bracket / Brace, and Block Options

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I would like to see more options with code folding and with bracket matching.
It seems the user base is quite split on how they want the collapsed region to display, so I think this should be a user configuration setting along with the other features listed.

### Feature Requests
1. Collapse fold to a single line [Related#2 Alternative Designs#1](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2948#issuecomment-183540068)
1. Bracket anchors/leads/lines seen in `pictures #2 and #3` + [Related#2 Alternative Designs#2](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2948#issuecomment-183540068)
1. Peek at top bracket when hovering the bottom bracket `pictures #3` This should only happen when the top matching bracket isn't visible on the current viewport.
1. Highlight current region. In `pictures #1 and #2` it highlights the current block you're on
1. Collapse block from bottom bracket. In `pictures #1 and #3` you can collapse a block region from the lower bracket which can be really nice, it can be a quick way to see what the bracket belongs to w/o feature `request #3`

### Picture examples
1. Single line collapse
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12663081/22518992/9aacab42-e863-11e6-8c41-068ed3e629f8.png)
1. Anchor / leads / lines
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12663081/22526296/87ce5d88-e87f-11e6-9065-5cf626a7441c.png)
1. Peek at top bracket
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12663081/22526602/b7da2380-e880-11e6-99fd-6f22296eccb1.png)

### Related
1. Collapse to same line #3352 
1. Icons for folding #2948

#### Labels
- editor 
- editor-folding 
- feature-request

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Don't open Untitled file when Welcome page is opened
data.body: Having both seems like too much. Instead we could add a New File action to the Start section. /cc @rebornix

data.title: Extension Icons missing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - OS Version: Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install VS Code with ninite 2. install any extension

A fresh install of the editor with Ninite results in extensions not having icons. Clicking any of them to open their pages does show full markdown support, including images.
